title: How to run the IPACS model
text: can install development version ipacs GitHub devtools::install_github("amyheather/ipacs"). first need install devtools, already installed. , load ipacs package using library(). Set value objects may wish change. example, system.file() used find example data stored IPACS package. However, can input string path desired file - e.g. `import_file(“myfile.xlsx”). Use import_file import sheets file containing model parameters. produce 5 dataframes: “arrivals_all”, “init_conds”, “capacity”, “losA” “costs”. R return multiple objects, return list dataframes list dataframe names, use assign create current environment. Use calculate_mu_sigma recalculate mu sigma losA dataframe using chosen method sd_los (applicable). Use create_scenarios create scenarios arr_scenarios.
code: library(ipacs) # String with file path for excel sheet with model inputs input_filename <- system.file("extdata", "IPACS_20230214_fix.xlsx", package="ipacs")  # Path to save output files to visit_filename <- "../inst/extdata/visit_output_using_IPACS_20230214_fix.csv" visit_stoch_filename <- "../inst/extdata/stochastic_visit_output_using_IPACS_20230214_fix.csv"  # Method for estimation of mu and sigma (for calculate_mu_sigma()) est_method <- 1  # Standard deviation for length of stay sd_los <- 3  # Number of runs for each simulation nruns <- 5  # Standard deviation for initial service/visit rate (ISR/IVR) and end service # rate/final visit rate (ESR/FVR) sd_isr <- 0.5 sd_esr <- 0.5  # Temporary seed temp_seed <- 1  # Warmup length warmup <- 0 files <- import_file(input_filename) for (x in seq_along(files[[1]])){   assign(files[[1]][x], files[[2]][[x]]) } losA <- calculate_mu_sigma() scenarios <- create_scenarios(scenarios=TRUE) arr_scenarios <- create_scenarios(scenarios=FALSE)

title: How to run the IPACS model
text: Set-: Use sim_setup create objects visit-based simulation. returned list, use assign extract add environment. Run simulation: Use run_visit_sim run visit-based simulation. Extract results (returned list). Save results: Use save_visit() extract results date number queue, occupancy, wait costs save csv. Use save_visit_stoch() correct date formatting save quantiles csv optional stochastic report, saving long format plotting.
code: setup_visit <- sim_setup("visit") for (i in seq_along(setup_visit[[1]])){   assign(setup_visit[[1]][i], setup_visit[[2]][[i]]) } visit_sim_result <- run_visit_sim() visits_based_output <- visit_sim_result[[1]] visits_based_output_q <- visit_sim_result[[2]] save_visit(visit_filename) save_visit_stoch(visit_stoch_filename)

title: How to run the IPACS model
text: Checks output simulations matchs outputs IPACS_MODEL repository.
code: test_visit <- read.csv("../inst/extdata/visit_testing_using_IPACS_20230214_fix.csv") new_visit <- read.csv("../inst/extdata/visit_output_using_IPACS_20230214_fix.csv") print(diffdf::diffdf(new_visit, test_visit)) #> No issues were found!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Amy Heather. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Heather (2023). ipacs: Improving Patient flow Acute, Community Social care (IPACS). https://github.com/amyheather/ipacs, https://amyheather.github.io/ipacs/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ipacs: Improving Patient flow between Acute, Community and Social care (IPACS)},   author = {Amy Heather},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/amyheather/ipacs, https://amyheather.github.io/ipacs/}, }

what: Improving Patient flow between Acute, Community and Social care (IPACS)
title: Improving Patient flow between Acute, Community and Social care (IPACS)
text: package contains models project “Improving Patient flow Acute, Community Social care (IPACS)”, converted package format. run model? Click : “run IPACS model”. find functions? Click : “Function reference”.  IPACS v1 model generic, open source, stochastic simulation model enables scenario modelling ‘Discharge Assess’ (D2A) resource requirements. models simple flows ’complex care‘ patients identified suitable discharge acute hospital bed non-acute care setting , time-limited, period rehabilitation assessment longer-term care requirements. comprises three distinct care pathways additional inputs community health social care provided seen flowchart. complex care pathways : P1 (visits-based care patient home receives care inputs location. Funded community health provider) P2 (non-acute, bed-based care funded community health provider) P3 (non-acute, bed-based care funded local authority social care provider). package version just includes example P1 pathway (visit-based simulation). currently include bed-based simulation report generation.

title: Add patient — add_patient
text: Add patient visit-based simulation pathway

title: Add patient — add_patient
code: add_patient(   in_system,   id = parent.frame()$id,   npat = parent.frame()$npat,   req_visits = parent.frame()$req_visits,   patients = parent.frame()$patients,   resources = parent.frame()$resources,   t = parent.frame()$t,   z = parent.frame()$z,   srv_dist_visit = parent.frame()$srv_dist_visit,   srv_params_visit = parent.frame()$srv_params_visit,   mean_los_visit = parent.frame()$mean_los_visit,   sd_los_visit = parent.frame()$sd_los_visit,   isr = parent.frame()$isr,   sd_isr = parent.frame()$sd_isr,   n_slots = parent.frame()$n_slots,   end_sr = parent.frame()$end_sr,   sd_esr = parent.frame()$sd_esr )

title: Add patient — add_patient
text: in_system Boolean (TRUE FALSE) - patient already system? , produce adjusted length stay visit rates. id Integer - ID number npat Integer - number patients req_visits List store require visit vectors patient patients Dataframe store information patient (create_patient_df()) resources Dataframe capture information available resources t Integer - day simulation, e.g. 1 z Integer - refers current scenario location simulation loops pathway_vector_visit, e.g. 4 srv_dist_visit List distribution length stay, e.g. list("lnorm", "lnorm") srv_params_visit List containing mean SD lnorm length stay distribution, e.g. list(c(1.52, 1.32), c(1.60, 1.33)) mean_los_visit List floats - float mean normal length stay distribution, e.g. list(12.08, 10) sd_los_visit List standard deviation normal length stay distribution, e.g. list(3, 3) isr Integer vector - initial service rate (ISR) initial visit rate (IVR) - used estimation initial number visits required patient, e.g. c(4, 4) sd_isr Float vector - float standard deviation initial service rate distribution, e.g. c(0.5, 0.5) n_slots Float vector - number visit slots available per day end_sr Integer vector - end service rate (end_sr) final visit rate (FVR) - used estimation final number visits required patient, e.g. c(1, 1) sd_esr Float vector - float standard deviation end service rate distribution, e.g. c(0.5, 0.5)

title: Add patient — add_patient
text: List updated id, npat, req_visits, patients, resources objects

title: Add patient — add_patient
text: run add_patient(), increment ID n_pat, find length stay, initial visit rate end visit rate. save results dataframe, check availability service modify resources accordingly.

title: Calculate mu and sigma — calculate_mu_sigma
text: Calculates mu sigma, stores within los_params, within length stay dataframe (losA).

title: Calculate mu and sigma — calculate_mu_sigma
code: calculate_mu_sigma(   est_method = parent.frame()$est_method,   losA = parent.frame()$losA,   sd_los = parent.frame()$sd_los )

title: Calculate mu and sigma — calculate_mu_sigma
text: est_method Integer - indicates estimation method use, either 1 2 losA Dataframe - imported excel, contains length stay parameters sd_los Float - standard deviation length stay distribution

title: Calculate mu and sigma — calculate_mu_sigma
text: losA dataframe new mu, sigma los_params columns.

title: Calculate mu and sigma — calculate_mu_sigma
code: if (FALSE) { losA <- calculate_mu_sigma(est_method = 1, losA = losA, sd_los = 3) }

what: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
title: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
text: Sample normal distribution find number visits required patient's final day pathway.

title: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
code: dis_end_slots(   z = parent.frame()$z,   end_sr = parent.frame()$end_sr[z],   sd_esr = parent.frame()$sd_esr[z] )

title: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
text: z String - scenario end_sr Float - mean ESR distribution - default end_sr vector sd_esr float - standard deviation ESR distribution - default sd_esr vector

title: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
text: x Integer - end service rate

title: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
text: End service rate (ESR) final visit rate (FVR) normal distribution. Based provided mean SD distribution, samples get ESR/FVR. () less 0, (b) mean+SD*3.

title: Sample end number of visits — dis_end_slots
code: dis_end_slots(z = "P1_B_BCap_Blos_BArr", end_sr = 1, sd_esr = 0.5) #> [1] 1

text: Sample normal distribution find number visits required patient enters pathway.

title: Sample initial number of visits — dis_init_slots
text: z String - scenario isr Float - mean ISR distribution - default isr vector sd_isr Float - standard deviation ISR distribution - default sd_isr vector n_slots Float - number visit slots available per day - default n_slots vector

title: Sample initial number of visits — dis_init_slots
text: Integer - initial service rate

title: Sample initial number of visits — dis_init_slots
text: Initial service rate (ISR) initial visit rate (IVR) normal distribution. Based provided mean SD distribution, samples get ISR/IVR. () less 0, (b) mean+SD*3, (c) n_slots

title: Sample initial number of visits — dis_init_slots
code: dis_init_slots(z = "P1_B_BCap_Blos_BArr", isr = 4, sd_isr = 0.5, n_slots = 230) #> [1] 4

what: Sample from length of stay (LOS) distribution — dis_los
title: Sample from length of stay (LOS) distribution — dis_los
text: Calculates maximum LOS mean SD LOS distribution. LOS lnorm, sample rlnorm distribution get value >=0 <= max LOS. Uses .call() need input mean SD rlnorm() list

title: Sample from length of stay (LOS) distribution — dis_los
code: dis_los(   z = parent.frame()$z,   los_dist = parent.frame()$srv_dist_visit[[z]],   los_lnorm_mean_sd = parent.frame()$srv_params_visit[[z]],   los_norm_mean = parent.frame()$mean_los_visit[[z]],   los_norm_sd = parent.frame()$sd_los_visit[[z]] )

title: Sample from length of stay (LOS) distribution — dis_los
text: z Integer - refers current scenario location simulation loops pathway_vector_visit, e.g. 4 los_dist String - distribution type, e.g. "lnorm" - default srv_dist_visit los_lnorm_mean_sd Float vector - mean SD lnorm distribution, e.g. c(1.52 1.32) - default srv_params_visit los_norm_mean Float - mean distribution type, e.g. 10.23 - default mean_los_visit los_norm_sd Float - SD distribution type, e.g. 3 - default sd_los_visit

title: Sample from length of stay (LOS) distribution — dis_los
text: .integer(x) - length stay integer

title: Sample from length of stay (LOS) distribution — dis_los
code: dis_los(z = 1,         los_dist = "lnorm",         los_lnorm_mean_sd = c(2.197225, 1.180702),         los_norm_mean = 18.07,         los_norm_sd = 3) #> [1] 4

title: Shorten length of stay — dis_los2
text: Reduces length stay patients already service

title: Shorten length of stay — dis_los2
code: dis_los2(long_los)

title: Shorten length of stay — dis_los2
text: long_los Float - length stay (output dis_los())

title: Shorten length of stay — dis_los2
text: Integer - shortened length stay

title: Shorten length of stay — dis_los2
text: Samples uniform distribution 1 length stay (produced dis_los()). Rounds nearest integer. Assumption: patients stay least 1 day.

title: Import simulation excel file — import_file
text: Imports sheet excel file contain parameters simulation. File contain sheets "arrivals", "initial conditions", "capacity", "los" "costs". Returns dataframes, along list dataframe names.

title: Import simulation excel file — import_file
code: import_file(filename)

title: Import simulation excel file — import_file
text: filename String - path excel file

title: Import simulation excel file — import_file
text: List length 2. Contains list dataframe names list dataframes.

title: Import simulation excel file — import_file
code: if (FALSE) { import_file("ipacs_model_parameters.xlsx") }

title: Run visit-based simulation — run_visit_sim
text: run_visit_sim() runs visit-based simulation, returning standard stochastic outputs.

title: Run visit-based simulation — run_visit_sim
code: run_visit_sim(   pathway_vector_visit = parent.frame()$pathway_vector_visit,   nruns = parent.frame()$nruns,   temp_seed = parent.frame()$temp_seed,   sim_length = parent.frame()$sim_length,   warmup = parent.frame()$warmup,   init_occ_visit = parent.frame()$init_occ_visit,   init_niq_visit = parent.frame()$init_niq_visit,   arr_rates_visit = parent.frame()$arr_rates_visit,   mean_los_visit = parent.frame()$mean_los_visit,   costs_visit = parent.frame()$costs_visit,   cap_visit = parent.frame()$cap_visit,   scenarios_visit = parent.frame()$scenarios_visit,   srv_dist_visit = parent.frame()$srv_dist_visit,   srv_params_visit = parent.frame()$srv_params_visit,   sd_los_visit = parent.frame()$sd_los_visit,   sd_isr = parent.frame()$sd_isr,   sd_esr = parent.frame()$sd_esr )

title: Run visit-based simulation — run_visit_sim
text: pathway_vector_visit Character vector list scenarios, e.g. c("P1_B_BCap_Blos_BArr", "P1_B_BCap_S1los_BArr") nruns Integer - number times run simulation scenario, e.g. 5 temp_seed Integer - temporary seed value, used calculate seed simulation, e.g. 1 sim_length Integer - length simulation, e.g. 181 warmup Integer - length warmup, e.g. 0 init_occ_visit List integers - integer initial number patients occupying pathway simulation starts, e.g. list(71, 71) init_niq_visit List integers - integer initial number patients waiting queue enter pathway simulation starts, e.g. list(42, 42) arr_rates_visit Dataframe - first column date, subsequent columns scenario, elements dataframe arrival rate scenario date, e.g. data.frame(date = .Date(c("2023-01-01", "2023-01-02")), P1_B_BCap_Blos_BArr = c(3.790697, 3.047619)) mean_los_visit List floats - float mean normal length stay distribution, e.g. list(12.08, 10) costs_visit Dataframe - community cost acute cost location, e.g. data.frame(node = c("P1_B"), community_cost = c(125), acute_dtoc = c(346)) cap_visit Integer vector - integer capacity, length number scenarios/locations, e.g. c(92, 2000) scenarios_visit Dataframe scenarios visit-based simulation srv_dist_visit List distribution length stay, e.g. list("lnorm", "lnorm") srv_params_visit List containing mean SD lnorm length stay distribution, e.g. list(c(1.52, 1.32), c(1.60, 1.33)) sd_los_visit List standard deviation normal length stay distribution, e.g. list(3, 3) sd_isr Float - standard deviation initial service rate distribution, e.g. 0.5 sd_esr Float - standard deviation end service rate distribution, e.g. c(0.5, 0.5)

title: Run visit-based simulation — run_visit_sim
text: List containing visits_based_output visits_based_output_q visits_based_output - dataframe simulation results visits_based_output_q - dataframe stochastic results

title: Run visit-based simulation — run_visit_sim
code: # Function defaults to import objects of the same name of each param from # the current environment, so can run without specifying any inputs if (FALSE) { run_visit_sim() }

what: Save standard output from visit-based simulation — save_visit
title: Save standard output from visit-based simulation — save_visit
text: Extract results visit-based simulation output NIQ, OCC, wait costs, append together, along dates. Save csv using output filename specified.

title: Save standard output from visit-based simulation — save_visit
code: save_visit(   visit_filename,   arr_rates_visit = parent.frame()$arr_rates_visit,   visits_based_output = parent.frame()$visits_based_output )

title: Save standard output from visit-based simulation — save_visit
text: visit_filename string - path save output csv arr_rates_visit Dataframe - first column date, subsequent columns scenario, elements dataframe arrival rate scenario date, e.g. data.frame(date = .Date(c("2023-01-01", "2023-01-02")), P1_B_BCap_Blos_BArr = c(3.790697, 3.047619)) visits_based_output Dataframe results visit-based simulation

title: Save standard output from visit-based simulation — save_visit
text: Saves csv specified location

what: Save stochastic output from visit-based simulation — save_visit_stoch

text: Correct date formatting, save quantiles csv optional stochastic report, saving long format plotting

title: Save stochastic output from visit-based simulation — save_visit_stoch
code: save_visit_stoch(   visit_stoch_filename,   visits_based_output_q = parent.frame()$visits_based_output_q )

title: Save stochastic output from visit-based simulation — save_visit_stoch
text: visit_stoch_filename String - path save output csv visits_based_output_q Dataframe stochastic results visit-based simulation

title: Save stochastic output from visit-based simulation — save_visit_stoch
text: Saves csv specified location

title: Set-up for simulation — sim_setup
text: Filters scenarios, arr_scenarios costs visit bed pathways. Extracts parameters scenarios dataframe. Pivots subset arr_scenarios. Creates vector scenario name.

title: Set-up for simulation — sim_setup
code: sim_setup(   model_type,   scenarios = parent.frame()$scenarios,   arr_scenarios = parent.frame()$arr_scenarios,   costs = parent.frame()$costs,   sd_los = parent.frame()$sd_los )

title: Set-up for simulation — sim_setup
text: model_type String - either "visit" "bed" scenarios Dataframe information scenarios arr_scenarios Dataframe information arrival scenarios costs Dataframe costs community acute location pathway sd_los Float - standard deviation length stay distribution

title: Set-up for simulation — sim_setup
text: List object names objects
